title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 229.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 229.1 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) The term
heating value per cubic foot shall be defined as being identical to that of
total calorific value provided by the current relevant code of the American

Society for Testing and Materials. It may be expressed on a wet or dry basis
and so labeled. The factor for converting heating value per cubic foot on the
wet basis to the dry basis at 60 degrees Fahrenheit, and the same pressure base
conditions, is 1.0177. Except where noted, the wet basis of measurement is
inferred in the remainder of this Part. (b) One therm is equal to 100,000 British
thermal units. (c) Therm billing is
defined as a method of billing consumers, for the actual amount of energy used, in units of therms. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
229.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
